translations.name: Norwegian Bible Society Bible
translations.description: The 1904 Bible, which was translated from the Greek and Hebrew and published by the Norse Bible Society, is the first ever complete translation of the Bible into Norwegian. It was a formal equivalence translation which means that it took a literalist instead of an interpretive approach.

translations.name: Det Norsk Bibelselskap
translations.description: The 1904 Bible, which was translated from the Greek and Hebrew and published by the Norse Bible Society, is the first ever complete translation of the Bible into Norwegian.
